website_summaries.verdict: This countersink drill bit set provides a terrific choice for use with handheld and stationary drills.
pros: High-speed steel construction guarantees the drill bits are built to last
Drill bits feature a black oxide finish that limits the risk of corrosion
Each drill bit boasts a 5-flute design that will help you drill smoothly time and time again
Offers a wonderful countersink drill bit set for professionals and do-it-yourselfers alike
cons: Pricey in comparison to similar countersink drill bit sets

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Five stars up front. They're plenty sharp. Too much pressure and they grab and spin in the chuck. Somewhat chattery, but peerfectly suitable for my needs. Just countersinking some 3/8" flat head bolts on a work table with quarter inch mild steel top
customer_reviews.author: Phil R.

customer_reviews.title: Chattery as all get out.
customer_reviews.text: Everything was clamped securely, lubricated with Magic Tap and used slow even pressure on my drill press and STILL couldn't get a clean countersink in Carbon steel OR soft Brass. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rmw156

customer_reviews.title: Good for Mild Steel
customer_reviews.text: These work great for mild steel on the slowest speed on your drill, don't work so well on stainless
customer_reviews.author: Matt Munns

customer_reviews.title: Chattery - leaves a rough hole
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy these again. In a drill press, work clamped down, lubricated, still very chattery and left washboard around the bevel.
customer_reviews.author: S. Patrick Sparks

customer_reviews.title: works pretty good....in the right tool
customer_reviews.text: works pretty good in a variable hand drill, no surprise there but it doesn't work so well in a drill press...that was a surprise. i suspect its because i had a speed selected that was too fast for the countersink but was appropriate for the drill bit i just used. Problem here is that changing speeds on most drill presses is a PITA with the pulleys and all. so i went to a variable speed hand drill & it worked just fine. Slower speeds seem to be best. Also don't be fooled by some of the videos saying running these bits in reverse gives you a clean cut....it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Tool Nut

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price and the DIY dad
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a couple of weeks now and for the price they're working fine. I dropped them 1 star for needing a sharpen out of the box (holes started looking hexagonal shape). But after a quick sharpen they're running great. Tried them through Plywood, softwood and hardwood. Haven't tried metals yet. Perfect if you don't want to spend a huge amount.
customer_reviews.author: matt pearson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, very sharp. I bought these after buying a cheap set for $11.99 and finding them not sharp enough for me (I was drilling screw holes in fiberglass and needed to countersink them first to keep from cracking the old gelcoat, so the sharper the better). I should have just gone with Irwin to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: BobW

customer_reviews.title: Better results with a larger drill bit to countersink
customer_reviews.text: Do not perform well. Better results with a larger drill bit to countersink. Hopefully I will find a soft metal to use them on so not a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Brian martin

customer_reviews.title: NICE LOGICAL CASE
customer_reviews.text: THIS is what all cases should be like : clearly marked sizes 1⁄4 3⁄8 1⁄2 and the like and the bit are securely locked in their little slots. The bits will only fit in their own "homes" too... impossible to get confused. I knew IRWIN could do it, now if they would just upgrade their tap & die set # 117 the same way.
customer_reviews.author: Jona

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it is an error on my part or if counter sink bits are measured different but when trying to bevel a 1/2” hole I have to use the 3/4” bit and it is barely enough. They were very sharp out of the box but after 2 holes you have to sharpen them.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Use a drill press
customer_reviews.text: I love these bits! I've seen some general complaints about c'sink bits chattering, leaving a rough countersink. I found that it's important to use a LOW speed, and a drill press with no side-play in the quill. My old Craftsman press chattered like crazy with a lot of side-play in the quill, but my Harbor Freight press made smooth c'sinks, with no quill side-play.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J.

customer_reviews.title: I have been using these countersink bits for a very ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these countersink bits for a very long time, they keep the sharp edge on fiberglass and green board.
customer_reviews.author: DCS camo

customer_reviews.title: Best countersink
customer_reviews.text: Gotta love these, had an irwin before and used for 10 years. This time bought the set and look and feel the same as the one I had before. Heavy weight and solid
customer_reviews.author: TedW

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, that holds up even on metal. Also comes with a case
customer_reviews.text: These countersink bits are great. Especially for the price. Yes you can pickup a set cheaper but they won't hold up. I've used these on wood countless times. I've also used them on aluminum a decent amount. They've held up well. Still no signs of wear. I've had some, that as soon as you use them on metal their done. These also come with a case, which makes them easy to find in a bag or tool chest.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye2133

customer_reviews.title: Where have these bits been all my life!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These bits are great! Have been blown away at well they cut through cast iron. These bits eat metal like it's butter. Would definitely buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Pibb

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with it. I actually used these in my mill to countersink holes when I broke a bit. They're straight enough to use with that and they aren't even meant to be used for a mill. I'm pretty impressed with them
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Countersinks cut cleanly
customer_reviews.text: These countersinks perform well. Cut a clean hole in metal and plastic using the correct speed on the drill press. Anticipate a long life
customer_reviews.author: Hubert L. Anderson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Meh, just OK
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set hoping it would be great. They work, but they aren't great. I think my cheap ones from Harbor Freight work better.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: They look nice.
customer_reviews.text: I know they are not M.A. Ford's but they do look nice. We'll see how they perform.
customer_reviews.author: prairie canoe

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great product, for a great price, easy and very convenient for CNC machinist work, very well made for cutting and chamferin holes..
customer_reviews.author: Firo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set, albeit expensive. Countersinks are very sharp, and don't have any fraying of wood, even plywood.
customer_reviews.author: California Doug

customer_reviews.title: One. 75 sink would be enough. And a ...
customer_reviews.text: One .75 sink would be enough. And a single glut will pass these things all day in steel.
customer_reviews.author: Hacker

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It tapers and counters what else do you need to know?
customer_reviews.author: Etowah

customer_reviews.title: Decent set of countersinks.
customer_reviews.text: These are fairly good set of countersinks. Some chatter so you have to work them slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Brown

customer_reviews.title: Seems good quality
customer_reviews.text: The Irwin brand was the deciding factor in this purchase. I've used one of the set and it cut clean. Longevity and durability are TBD, but I expect good service life from an Irwin tool.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Good set of counter sinks
customer_reviews.text: These counter sinks work great. Pretty sharp and have been working well for a couple of Years...I love the carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: michael J Bull

customer_reviews.title: Cattier when cutting
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged and well made. They tend to chatter when cutting and don’t leave a smooth finish to the hole
customer_reviews.author: TJH

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Great value if looking for a inexpensive set for general use around home.
customer_reviews.author: tommyb

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: Good and bad. They’re of decent quality and the price is great but because they have a straight flute they chatter quite a bit. I found rocking them in a hand drill when chamfering helps but for countersinking you just have to live with the chatter.
customer_reviews.author: Ed P

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've used a couple of these several times on wood. They work well for me so far. As with all rotary tool and bits, you must take your time and not use excessive pressure, and they will do the job intended and last. For the price these are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in NC

customer_reviews.title: very good set of countersinks in case
customer_reviews.text: very smooth cutting for the ones I have used sofar
customer_reviews.author: Vernon C. Stroble

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on el-cheapo alternatives
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of Irwin tools. Good balance between value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: mghpz27

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Set, Everyone Should Have One
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of counter sinks. Have used them mostly on Aluminum, Plywood and Polycarbonate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good on boat gel coat
customer_reviews.text: bought set to add trim tabs to boat... clean cut.
customer_reviews.author: syakely

customer_reviews.title: No chatter when in use
customer_reviews.text: I like the price , quality for a low price , and I use them at work , building new details for die production
customer_reviews.author: hugh lafever

customer_reviews.title: Irwin makes good mid grade tools tools.
customer_reviews.text: Good basic home and light fabrication set. Not meant for production and priced very affordably for the home owner of model shop.
customer_reviews.author: Laar

customer_reviews.title: Counter sink
customer_reviews.text: Works good for what I need it for at work.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk A.

customer_reviews.title: A complete package of the common sizes.
customer_reviews.text: A nice set of the common sizes used. I really like the compact/sturdy case; makes storing and protecting them quite simple.
customer_reviews.author: tooolboxx

customer_reviews.title: Not USA made but ok
customer_reviews.text: Good tools and nice case to store them. I just wish they were made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: ahiker4u

customer_reviews.title: Chatterless. Good value
customer_reviews.text: Nice set. Chatterless. Be sure to run at a lower speed on mild steel and the performance is excellent. I will be buying another set.
customer_reviews.author: brad troutman

customer_reviews.title: Bought mainly for wood. They work well
customer_reviews.text: For the price range I won't complain. nice case, shipped fast and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H. Buck

customer_reviews.title: I love Irwin tools!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. Slowly building my woodworking tool collection. I love Irwin tools.
customer_reviews.author: H2Odog477

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Made quick work of my metal parts after eating up 4 single sided cutting bits. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: These are going to be very handy both for work ...
customer_reviews.text: These are going to be very handy both for work (I'm an independent locksmith) and for hobby use (I make and repair stuff from time to time).
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Have no problems yet. Bought them to countersink in mild steel and performed great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: They did great, however the shank is not long enough for the project I was working on. Did great otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a good set but you need to run them very slow to prevent chatter
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: Not so bad
customer_reviews.text: I use them for metal, works well to deburr but leaves a choppy finish at times. Not sure if it will work well when I have to use on stainless. Will update in time.
customer_reviews.author: Marksman

customer_reviews.title: Just as intended.
customer_reviews.text: They work really good. The case is nice to keep them all in one place and in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wright

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine in wood or aluminum. Have only used a few times so can't comment on durability.
customer_reviews.author: ByG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for me in plywood. Need to try in steel and aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bosh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works on wood and other soft materials like a champs. Removes material instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works very well on steel once you figure out the pressure and speed for your drill to keep them from chattering.
customer_reviews.author: tkschelle

customer_reviews.title: Fairly Durable
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used this on stainless steel, and it works great. Used for a couple months now.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: Easy of changing.
customer_reviews.text: The shanks are the same size so makes it easy to change to a larger or smaller counter sink
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Moore

customer_reviews.title: Work very well
customer_reviews.text: Bought a cheaper set and they burned the wood. These perform very well. Sharp and hold an edge.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Bill

customer_reviews.title: innovative products from irwin
customer_reviews.text: Great product work well nice size range nice case to keep them in order.
customer_reviews.author: L. R. Krause

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I do metal working. These do a good job at quick chamfering
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Coldwell

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I used it to countersink a hole in a steel shaft
customer_reviews.author: A.E.R.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp tool
customer_reviews.text: These tools are great .. sharp and work as you would expect them to
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used it to machine HDPE plastic - works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used these in the past, needed a new set for a diffrent employer. Work great
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: These work great in just about any material from stainless to wood
customer_reviews.text: These work great in just about any material from stainless to wood. They tend to jump and chatter more as the material gets softer. Recommend lots of lube/ drill chill
customer_reviews.author: Sean McKeen

customer_reviews.title: Slightly chatter
customer_reviews.text: They chatter a little even at slow speeds. But it gets the bur out so its all that matters. I'm no machinest so I don't need perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Flip Alarcon

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable for occasional use. Made in China / North Korea.
customer_reviews.text: Acceptable for occasional use. Made in China / North Korea. Probably not good enough if you earn your living with these kinds of tools. They are not up to the quality you would find by buying American-made counter-sinks sold by McMaster Carr.
customer_reviews.author: Skyhawk

customer_reviews.title: I'm an Iorn Worker and use these alot on posts ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm an Iorn Worker and use these alot on posts and base plates for railings. They work but they don't stay sharp for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: resulting in terrible results. initially I thought the fluids were the ...
customer_reviews.text: tons of chatter, resulting in chopping finish. initially I thought the fluids were the result, but mounted them to my drill press and realized there was a ton of wobble in the cutter head themselves. It's ok for wood but as soon as you put this to metal, it'll vibrate your drill press and ruin your part. Just going to get someinstead.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Lin

customer_reviews.title: Used one of the countersink on brass. Does not ...
customer_reviews.text: Used one of the countersink on brass. Does not give a clean smooth cut as expected. Well made but do not perform the way they should.
customer_reviews.author: Mondone

customer_reviews.title: the case is nice. I dont think i would get them again ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality is ok. the case is nice. I dont think i would get them again but did the job ok.
customer_reviews.author: HK

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Use these all the time, If they ever get dull, I will replace them immediately
customer_reviews.author: Dave Erving

customer_reviews.title: Stick with top line
customer_reviews.text: Irwin, or Irwin Hanson tools, have always been top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. New out of the box, these bits only do a fair job beveling in hardwood. When I needed to bevel six screw holes in soft metal the 1/2 inch bit failed. By the 5th hole it smoked and I barely finished the sixth hole. I threw it in the trash after the last hole. I will be looking for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Terrible QC - I just opened the box after purchasing over a month ago, and the 1/4 is missing. Since It was over a month, now I can return it. Double check your order as soon as it comes in. If this was cheap knock off I would not be surprised, but I would expect better quality control from Irwin.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: Too small for what I was looking for had to return item but they looked to be very good quality
customer_reviews.author: Mattmike757

product_meta.title: IRWIN Countersink Drill Bit Set for Metal, 5-Piece (1877793)
product_meta.description:
The IRWIN Metal Countersink Drill Bit Set features precision ground 82° tips for countersinking most machinable metals, wood, and plastic. Made from industrial grade high-speed steel for increased durability, each countersink has a black oxide coating to resist corrosion and a five-flute design that reduces vibration for smoother drilling and an extended life. Set includes 1/4", 3/8", 1/2", 5/8", and 3/4" countersinks, and a drawer Case

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
IRWIN High Speed Steel Countersinks feature a precision-ground 82-degree tip that makes them ideal for countersinking into most machinable metals. They're made from industrial grade high speed steel for increased durability, and they include a black oxide finish for added corrosion resistance. The five flute design reduces vibration for smoother drilling and extended life. Plus, the 1/4" round shank fits all handheld and stationary drills.
feature_bullets: Precision ground 82° tip for countersinking most machinable metals, wood, and plastic
Made from industrial grade high speed steel for increased durability
Includes a black oxide finish for added corrosion resistance
Five-flute design reduces vibration for smoother drilling and extended life
1/4" round shank fits all handheld and stationary drills

specifications.Included Components: 5 Countersink metal drill bits, plus drawer case
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars471 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
